title: Has the reign of social media ended?
summary: After 20 years of domination by the major social media platforms, the way we use the internet has changed. People now seek refuge in private bubbles, relegating the large platforms to spaces for entertainment rather than for conversation, and where a shared culture struggles to survive.

title: Macron calls on Iran's president to back Middle East 'de-escalation'
summary: The French president spoke with Masoud Pezeshkian via telephone to discuss ways to secure a 'ceasefire between Hezbollah and Israel' a statement read on Sunday on the Iranian presidential website.

title: Dozens hurt and four killed in Israel as Hezbollah claims drone strike, threatens more attacks
summary: The number of injured in Binyamina is one of the largest in Israel since the Israel-Hezbollah war escalated in late September. Later on Sunday, the Iran-backed group 'promises' the attack 'is nothing compared to what awaits' if Israel aggresses further.

title: US to send missile defense system to Israel and troops to operate it
summary: The Pentagon said it would send a Terminal High Altitude Area Defense (THAAD) battery  to bolster Israel's air defenses.

title: Armed man arrested near Trump rally in California, sheriff says they 'probably' prevented 'third assassination attempt'
summary: Vem Miller, 49, of Las Vegas was arrested near the rally after driving up in an unregistered black SUV possessing a loaded firearm and a high-capacity magazine, per the Riverside County sheriff's office. After getting booked, he was later released on bail.

title: The anguish of Lebanese artists invited to France for the Fall Festival
summary: Current events in the Middle East and the Israeli army's strikes against Hezbollah in Lebanon have had a major impact on the work of directors Lina Majdalanie and Rabih Mroué, who are currently being honored by the Paris Fall Festival.

title: UN peacekeepers say Israeli tanks 'forcibly entered' position in Lebanon
summary: Earlier, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu had called on the UN chief to move peacekeepers in southern Lebanon out of 'harm's way.'

title: In Athens, the death of a Pakistani migrant in a police station sparks outrage
summary: The circumstances of Muhammad Kamran Ashiq's death, and photos of his badly injured body, have prompted the Ombudsman to launch an independent investigation.

title: SpaceX 'catches' megarocket booster after test flight
summary: The Starship megarocket successfully flew back to its launch pad after a test flight and was caught by large mechanical arms.

title: 'We learned from Iceland's mistakes': The Faroe Islands' hopes and fears about tourism boom
summary: This archipelago, located between Iceland and Norway, has been welcoming tourists for the past 10 years, in ever-increasing numbers. Local residents are divided over the changes that are shaking up a traditional, long-isolated society.

title: Why the Gaza Health Ministry's death count is considered reliable
summary: Since the start of the war between Israel and Hamas on October 7, 2023, the credibility of the figures published by the Hamas-run administration has been regularly questioned.

title: Isabelle Bernard, wife of murdered French teacher: 'Secularism is a framework for living well together'
summary: Dominique Bernard's wife has not spoken publicly since her husband's murder in Arras on October 13, 2023. In an interview with Le Monde, she speaks about her husband's values of humanism and tolerance.

title: Han Kang's Nobel Prize for Literature, a cause for pride in South Korea
summary: Very attached to its international recognition, the country, which has conquered the world with its films and K-Pop, welcomed the award given to its novelist.

title: Kenya's Chepngetich shatters women's marathon world record in Chicago
summary: Ruth Chepngetich shaved almost two minutes off the world record, setting the new time at 2:09:56. John Korir won the men's race.

title: Trump and Musk put on a show. Does anyone care?
summary: On October 5, the billionaires Elon Musk and Donald Trump performed a theatrical pas de deux at a rally in Butler, Pennsylvania.

title: In Tyre, the capital of southern Lebanon, war is back
summary: The port city, which had been a stronghold of resistance to Israeli occupation in the 1980s and 1990s, has seen most of its population leave. The city's central districts have been the target of several deadly strikes.

title: Iceland's government coalition collapses, new elections to be held in November
summary: Prime Minister Bjarni Benediktsson said his 'vision for the future' was too different from his coalition partner the Left-Green Movement's.

title: 'New romance,' a growing literary genre and gold mine for publishers
summary: The literary niche, targetting an almost exclusively female audience, saw its sales double last year. Publishers are trying to carve out their slice of the pie.

title: French government's fragile coalition put to the test by budget bill
summary: Prime Minister Michel Barnier's 2025 budget bill has been criticized by figures within his own majority, from Macronists who haven't accepted their loss of power to turbulent right-wing lawmakers.

title: In Kursk, 'a long temporary period ahead' for Russians fleeing the Ukrainian-occupied zone
summary: The Russian authorities have organized aid almost two months after the invasion of part of the region. The 150,000 Russian refugees are torn between the anguish of being far from home and, for some, the feeling of having been abandoned.

title: Who is Lord Alli, the British Labour Party's generous and cumbersome donor?
summary: The British Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer is in the eye of a storm following the revelation that he received multiple gifts from a wealthy businessman close to the Labour Party, which has caused a scandal in the context of severe budget cuts.

title: Riad Sattouf, autobiographer of other people's lives
summary: The cartoonist is not quite done with 'The Arab of the Future,' his hugely successful series. With his latest work, he adds to the central story with a superb counterpoint. Here, we look back on an equally singular and endearing saga.

title: Amandine Henry retires from international football
summary: The midfielder's last appearance for France was at the Paris Olympics where the 2024 Games' hosts were knocked out in the quarter-finals by Brazil.

title: Pelicot rape trial: 'The victims' courage has transformed justice into an instrument of public debate'
summary: Forty-six years ago, a famous trial in Aix, southern France, led to a change in the law to better define rape. The ongoing trial in Avignon should bring about similar change, writes Le Monde's columnist Philippe Bernard.

title: Taiwan military on high alert as China holds drills around island
summary: China is holding military exercises around Taiwan, a move that Taiwan condemned as 'irrational and provocative' behavior.

title: 'Kamala Harris' caring, liberal capitalism, which is blind to differences, is in every way opposed to that embodied and defended by Donald Trump'
summary: In an op-ed for 'Le Monde,' historian Sylvie Laurent observes that the Democratic candidate wants to resurrect a restrained capitalism, while her Republican opponent defends a racial national capitalism serving the white male.

title: According to Trump, 'Christians love Israel more than Jews'
summary: The US presidential candidate has repeatedly accused American Jews of a lack of 'loyalty' to both Israel and the Republican camp.

title: One year after a terrorist murdered a teacher, an entire community's trauma persists
summary: A tribute was paid to murdered literature teacher Dominique Bernard on Friday, at the school in northern France where he was killed. A public ceremony is being organized on Sunday, with Isabelle Bernard, the teacher's widow.

title: Rami Abou Jamous, witness of Gaza's hell, wins three prizes at Bayeux war correspondents' awards
summary: For the past year, this French-speaking Palestinian journalist has been reporting on the Israeli offensive that is destroying the coastal territory, for the 'Orient XXI' website and several television channels. He has just won three awards at the prestigious Bayeux Calvados-Normandie Prize.

title: French government wants new immigration bill in 2025, less than a year after the last one
summary: Government spokeswoman Maud Bregeon confirmed the bill will include measures 'useful for protecting the French.'

title: US imposes new, limited sanctions on Iran
summary: The measures adopted on October 11 target Iran's petrochemical and oil industries as well as some 20 ships and several companies abroad that have been accused of facilitating transport, exports or production in these sectors.

title: Beirut is caught in the crossfire, its inhabitants split between apathy and solidarity with refugees
summary: The war has hit a city at the end of its tether, still reeling from the 2019 financial crisis and the devastating port explosion the following year, but thousands have flocked there from the south, fleeing bombings.

title: Nobel economics prize awarded for research into differences in prosperity between nations
summary: Three researchers at American universities were awarded the Nobel memorial prize in economics for their research into why some societies are wealthier than others.

title: UNIFIL, the peacekeeping mission whose history is intertwined with the tragedies of southern Lebanon
summary: The United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon has been on mission – and caught in the middle of the conflict – since 1978, when Israel first invaded the south of the country.

title: Increase in loggerhead turtle nests found on French beaches
summary: Found mainly in Greece and Turkey, these turtles – a protected species – have been laying eggs on France's Mediterranean coast for the past two years.

title: 'Israel wants to intimidate us. They want us to leave,' says French military source
summary: Over the past few days, the Israeli army has stepped up its targeting of UNIFIL installations in southern Lebanon. Five peacekeepers have been wounded in these attacks.

title: Israel steps up attacks against the United Nations
summary: Benjamin Netanyahu's government is increasingly attacking UNIFIL and UNRWA, the Palestinian refugee agency. UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres has been declared persona non grata on Israeli soil.

title: Florists, the overlooked victims of pesticides: 'If someone had warned me, my daughter would still be here'
summary: Emmy Marivain is the first child whose death has been recognized by the Pesticide Victims Compensation Fund. Her mother, an ex-florist, is seeking legal recognition of her family's suffering. She also warns of the risks incurred by florists.

title: Villas, luxury cars worth €70 million and belonging to Russian oligarchs seized in France
summary: The Paris prosecutor's office has obtained the seizure of these assets in an aggravated money laundering investigation, illustrating a new doctrine that reverses the burden of proof in opaque financial arrangements.

title: China encircles Taiwan in heightened military drills
summary: The Chinese army deployed fighter jets, bombers and warships to encircle the island.

title: US presidential election: A Trump victory could influence the International Energy Agency
summary: If the Republican candidate were to return to the White House, the organization focused on decarbonizing the sector would be targeted by the new administration.

title: Canada and India expel six of each other's diplomats
summary: Tensions between the two nations have escalated since Canada alleged that the Indian government was linked to the June 2023 assassination of Sikh activist Hardeep Singh Nijjar.

title: Le Pen claims innocence in fake EU jobs trial
summary: French far-right leader Marine Le Pen strongly denied committing any wrongdoing at a Paris court Monday as she and her Rassemblement National party stand trial over the suspected embezzlement of European Parliament funds.

title: Alexei Navalny's 'Patriot,' the unfinished memoir of Putin's leading opponent
summary: In a book to be published on October 22 in France, Navalny recounts his childhood, the roots of his activism and his harrowing experience in Kharp prison in the Arctic, where he died in February.

title: The scourge of gang rape is nothing new
summary: A number of high-profile attacks have left their mark on public opinion, with victims now speaking out.

title: NASA probe lifts off to discover whether Jupiter's icy moon has life
summary: The Europa Clipper launched Monday to explore Jupiter's moon Europa and investigate whether its hidden ocean could support life. It will take 5.5 years to reach Jupiter, where it will orbit the planet and conduct multiple flybys.
